item.title: US strikes on Latin American 'drug boats': What do we know, and are they legal?
item.description: Experts have suggested several attacks launched by the US may be illegal under international law.

item.title: Catholic clergy sex abuse victims hopeful after Pope Leo meeting
item.description: The Pope acknowledged "resistance in some parts of the world" to permanently remove a priest who abuses a child, the group said.

item.title: Former NFL player Doug Martin dies in police custody in California
item.description: His former team, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, said they were "deeply saddened" by the ex-player's death.

item.title: Palestinian woman in hospital after being clubbed by masked Israeli settler
item.description: The attacker is seen striking the 55-year-old woman with a large wooden stick during the assault in the West Bank village of Turmus Ayaa.

item.title: These confederate statues caused US protests. Knocked down, they're the centre of a new art show
item.description: The 18 decommissioned Confederate monuments have been deconstructed and displayed to make a statement on the horrors of slavery.
